entry.content:
Walt Disney was a showman. According to Time, he â€œreceived more Academy Awards and nominations than any other person in history.â€ The Disneyland theme parks are truly magical kingdoms, for adults, as well as for children.
åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼æ˜¯ä½è¡¨æ¼”è€…ã€‚æ®ã€Šæ—¶ä»£ã€‹æŠ¥é“ï¼Œä»–â€œæ”¶åˆ°çš„å¥¥æ–¯å¡å¥–é¡¹å’Œæåæ˜¯å²ä¸Šæœ€å¤šçš„ã€‚â€ è¿ªå£«å°¼ä¸»é¢˜å…¬å›­å¯¹æˆå¹´äººæ¥è¯´éƒ½æ˜¯é­”å¹»ç‹å›½ï¼Œæ›´åˆ«æå­©å­ä»¬äº†ã€‚
Here are some Walt Disney lessons in making your dreams come true, courtesy of the master of imagination, dreaming, and achievement himself.
ä¸‹é¢çš„è¿™äº›åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼çš„äººç”Ÿè¯¾èƒ½è®©ä½ çš„æ¢¦æƒ³æˆçœŸï¼Œè®©ä½ æˆä¸ºæƒ³è±¡åŠ›å’Œæ¢¦æƒ³çš„å¤§å¸ˆï¼Œå¹¶æœ‰æ‰€æˆå°±ã€‚

1. Dream Big

å°½æƒ…æ¢¦æƒ³

â€œIf you can dream it, you can do it.â€ - Walt Disney
â€œå¦‚æœä½ èƒ½æ¢¦æƒ³ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆä½ å°±èƒ½åšåˆ°ã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
What if money, time, looks, and gender were no object? What would your biggest dream be? Often we short-change ourselves. We listen to othersâ€™ put-downs, and internalize them. Itâ€™s hard to remember our dreams. Harder still, to imagine that we could achieve a dream. Take Walt Disneyâ€™s words to heart. Start dreaming. Then believe that you can achieve your dream.
å¦‚æœé‡‘é’±ã€æ—¶é—´ã€å¤–è²Œã€æ€§åˆ«éƒ½ä¸æˆé—®é¢˜ï¼Œé‚£ä½ æœ€å¤§çš„æ¢¦æƒ³æ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Ÿæˆ‘ä»¬ç»å¸¸æ¬ºéª—è‡ªå·±ã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬å¬åˆ«äººè¯´é‚£äº›è´¬ä½äººçš„è¯ï¼Œå¹¶è®©å®ƒä»¬æˆä¸ºè‡ªå·±æ€§æ ¼çš„ä¸€éƒ¨åˆ†ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¾ˆéš¾æƒ³èµ·è‡ªå·±çš„æ¢¦æƒ³ã€‚æ›´éš¾çš„æ˜¯å»æƒ³è±¡æˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥å®ç°æ¢¦æƒ³ã€‚æŠŠåç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼å…ˆç”Ÿçš„è¯è®°åœ¨å¿ƒé‡Œã€‚å¼€å§‹æ¢¦æƒ³ï¼Œç›¸ä¿¡ä½ å¯ä»¥å®ç°è‡ªå·±çš„æ¢¦æƒ³ã€‚

2. Be Courageous

å‹‡æ•¢èµ·æ¥

â€œAll our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.â€- Walt Disney
â€œå¦‚æœæˆ‘ä»¬æœ‰å‹‡æ°”å»è¿½æ±‚æ¢¦æƒ³ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆæˆ‘ä»¬æ‰€æœ‰çš„æ¢¦æƒ³éƒ½ä¼šæˆçœŸã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
It takes courage to step outside your comfort zone. However, achieving your dreams always means that youâ€™re doing things youâ€™ve never done before. Practice being courageous. Today, do something you havenâ€™t done before. Propose a new project to your boss. Send your crush some flowers. Being courageous doesnâ€™t mean that youâ€™re unafraid. It means acting in spite of your fear.
è¦æƒ³èµ°å‡ºèˆ’é€‚åŒºï¼Œå¿…é¡»éœ€è¦å‹‡æ°”ã€‚ä¸ç®¡æ€æ ·ï¼Œå®ç°æ¢¦æƒ³éƒ½æ„å‘³ç€ä½ è¦åšä»¥å‰æ²¡åšè¿‡çš„äº‹æƒ…ã€‚ç»ƒä¹ ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œè®©è‡ªå·±å‹‡æ•¢èµ·æ¥ã€‚ä»Šå¤©ï¼Œåšåšä½ ä»¥å‰æ²¡åšè¿‡çš„äº‹æƒ…ï¼šå‘ä½ çš„è€æ¿æè®®ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„é¡¹ç›®ï¼Œç»™ä½ å–œæ¬¢çš„äººé€äº›èŠ±å„¿ã€‚å‹‡æ•¢èµ·æ¥å¹¶ä¸æ˜¯è¯´ä½ æ— æ‰€ç•æƒ§ï¼Œå®ƒæŒ‡çš„æ˜¯å°½ç®¡å®³æ€•ä¹Ÿä¾ç„¶å»åšã€‚

3. Be Yourself

åšä½ è‡ªå·±

â€œThe more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.â€- Walt Disney
â€œä½ è¶Šå–œæ¬¢è‡ªå·±ï¼Œä½ å°±è¶Šä¸ä¼šæŠŠè‡ªå·±å’Œåˆ«äººç›¸ä¼¼ï¼Œè¿™ä¼šè®©ä½ ç‹¬ä¸€æ— äºŒã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
We all wear masks. We try to be what we think people want us to be. We try to emulate role models. What if you were just yourself? Discovering who you are underneath all the masks is challenging. Itâ€™s hard to be authentic if youâ€™re not sure who you are. Just for today, do what pleases you. Say what you mean, rather than saying what you think someone wants to hear. However, be appropriateâ€”being â€œlike yourselfâ€ isnâ€™t a license to be outrageous, or to say hurtful things.
æˆ‘ä»¬æ¯ä¸ªäººéƒ½æˆ´ç€é¢å…·ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬è¯•ç€å»æˆä¸ºåˆ«äººæƒ³è®©æˆ‘ä»¬æˆä¸ºçš„æ ·å­ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬è¯•ç€å»æ¨¡ä»¿æ¦œæ ·ã€‚å¦‚æœä½ å°±æ˜¯ä½ è‡ªå·±å‘¢ï¼Ÿæ‰¾å‡ºé¢å…·ä¸‹é¢çš„çœŸæˆ‘æ˜¯å¯ŒäºæŒ‘æˆ˜æ€§çš„ã€‚å¦‚æœä½ ä¸ç¡®å®šè‡ªå·±æ˜¯è°ï¼Œé‚£å¾ˆéš¾åšçœŸå®çš„è‡ªå·±ã€‚è¯´å‡ºä½ æƒ³è¡¨è¾¾çš„æ„æ€ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯ä½ è®¤ä¸ºåˆ«äººæƒ³å¬çš„è¯ã€‚ä½†ä¸ç®¡æ€æ ·ï¼Œä¹Ÿè¦æ°å½“ã€‚â€”â€”â€œå–œæ¬¢è‡ªå·±â€ å¹¶ä¸è¡¨ç¤ºè¦è¯­å‡ºæƒŠäººï¼Œæˆ–è¯´äº›ä¼¤äººå¿ƒçš„è¯è¯­ã€‚

4. Stop Talking. Start Doing

åœæ­¢äº¤è°ˆï¼Œå¼€å§‹å®å¹²ã€‚

â€œThe way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.â€- Walt Disney
â€œå¼€å§‹çš„æ–¹æ³•å°±æ˜¯åœæ­¢äº¤è°ˆå¹¶å¼€å§‹å®å¹²ã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
Youâ€™re dreaming big. Youâ€™re inspired. You tell everyone about your dream. Stop! Keep it to yourself. Work quietly towards your dream. You donâ€™t need validation from anyone, nor do you need permission. Be authentic, and do something today, which will help you to achieve your dream.
ä½ åœ¨å°½æƒ…åœ°æ¢¦æƒ³ã€‚ä½ å—åˆ°äº†é¼“èˆã€‚ä½ æŠŠæ¢¦æƒ³å‘Šè¯‰äº†å¤§å®¶ã€‚åœï¼åªè¦è‡ªå·±çŸ¥é“å°±è¡Œã€‚æ‚„æ‚„åœ°æœç€æ¢¦æƒ³åŠªåŠ›ã€‚ä½ ä¸å¿…éœ€è¦åˆ«äººçš„è®¤å¯ï¼Œä½ ä¹Ÿä¸éœ€è¦åˆ«äººçš„å‡†è®¸ã€‚åšçœŸå®çš„è‡ªå·±ï¼Œä»Šå¤©å°±åšäº›äº‹æƒ…ï¼Œè¿™ä¼šå¸®ä½ å®ç°æ¢¦æƒ³ã€‚

5. Embrace Competition

æ‹¥æŠ±ç«äº‰

â€œI have been up against tough competition all my life. I wouldnâ€™t know how to get along without it.â€- Walt Disney
â€œæˆ‘ä¸€ç”Ÿéƒ½åœ¨ä¸æ–­åœ°é¢ä¸´ç€ä¸¥å³»çš„ç«äº‰ã€‚æˆ‘ä¸çŸ¥é“æ²¡æœ‰ç«äº‰è¯¥å¦‚ä½•æ˜¯å¥½ã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
Competition is essential to help you to achieve your dreams. If there were no competition, youâ€™d have nothing against which to measure yourself. Competition makes you better and stronger than you might otherwise be. In business, competition fosters innovation. If youâ€™re uncomfortable with competition, or envious of competitors, ask yourself why. Then do the best you can.
ç«äº‰æ˜¯å¸®ä½ å®ç°æ¢¦æƒ³çš„å¿…è¦æ¡ä»¶ã€‚å¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰ç«äº‰ï¼Œé‚£ä½ å°±æ²¡ä»€ä¹ˆä¸œè¥¿æ¥è¡¡é‡è‡ªå·±ã€‚ç«äº‰ä¼šè®©ä½ å˜å¾—æ›´å¥½ã€æ›´å¼ºå¤§ã€‚åœ¨ä¸šåŠ¡æ–¹é¢ï¼Œç«äº‰å¯ä»¥ä¿ƒè¿›åˆ›æ–°ã€‚å¦‚æœä½ ä¸å–œæ¬¢ç«äº‰ï¼Œæˆ–ç¾¡æ…•ç«äº‰å¯¹æ‰‹ï¼Œé‚£ä½ è¯¥æƒ³æƒ³åŸå› ã€‚ç„¶åå°½ä½ æœ€å¤§çš„åŠªåŠ›ã€‚

6. Go and Get What You Want. Donâ€™t Wait

å»è¿½æ±‚å¹¶å¾—åˆ°ä½ æƒ³è¦çš„ï¼Œä¸è¦ç­‰å¾…ã€‚

â€œCinderella believed in dreams, all right, but she also believed in doing something about them. When Prince Charming didnâ€™t come along, she went over to the palace and got him.â€ - Walt Disney
â€œç°å§‘å¨˜ç›¸ä¿¡æ¢¦æƒ³ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¥¹ä¹Ÿç›¸ä¿¡è¦ä¸ºä¹‹å¥‹æ–—ã€‚å½“ç™½é©¬ç‹å­æ²¡æ¥æ—¶ï¼Œå¥¹å»äº†å®«æ®¿æ‰å¾—ä»¥é‡è§ä»–ã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
Forget wishing. No one is handed his dreams for free. You have to fight to achieve a dream. Expect to struggle. Ask yourself what price youâ€™re will to payâ€”dreams always have a price. However, itâ€™s not all doom and gloom. Setting goals, making plans, and working toward your dream is wonderful. Enjoy the journey. When youâ€™ve achieved a long-held dream, you find that while you appreciate the achievement, the memories of the journey are what make you smile.
åˆ«è®¸æ„¿äº†ã€‚æ²¡äººä¼šæ— å¿è®©å‡ºè‡ªå·±çš„æ¢¦æƒ³ã€‚è¦æƒ³å®ç°æ¢¦æƒ³ï¼Œä½ è¦å­¦ä¼šå»äº‰å–ã€‚ä½ è¦é¢„æ–™åˆ°è¦å’Œå›°éš¾åšæ–—äº‰ã€‚é—®é—®è‡ªå·±ä½ å‡†å¤‡è¦ä»˜çš„ä»£ä»·â€”â€”æ¢¦æƒ³æ€»æ˜¯æœ‰ä»£ä»·çš„ã€‚ç„¶è€Œï¼Œå®ƒå¹¶ä¸æ˜¯æ— æœ›çš„ã€‚è®¾å®šç›®æ ‡ï¼Œåˆ¶å®šè®¡åˆ’ï¼Œæœç€æ¢¦æƒ³å»åŠªåŠ›ï¼Œè¿™æ˜¯å¾ˆç¾å¥½çš„äº‹æƒ…ã€‚äº«å—è¿™ä¸ªè¿‡ç¨‹ã€‚å½“ä½ å®ç°äº†æ¢¦æƒ³å·²ä¹…çš„äº‹æƒ…åï¼Œä½ ä¼šå‘ç°ï¼Œè™½ç„¶ä½ å¾ˆæ¬£èµä½ çš„æˆæœï¼Œä½†æ˜¯è®©ä½ å¾®ç¬‘çš„å´æ˜¯è¿½æ±‚æ¢¦æƒ³è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­çš„ç‚¹ç‚¹æ»´æ»´ã€‚

7. Do Your Best Work. Donâ€™t Worry About Money

å°½ä½ æœ€å¤§çš„åŠªåŠ›ï¼Œä¸è¦æ‹…å¿ƒé’±çš„é—®é¢˜ã€‚

â€œDo a good job. You donâ€™t have to worry about the money; it will take care of itself. Just do your best workâ€”then try to trump it.â€ - Walt Disney
â€œå¥½å¥½åšã€‚ä¸è¦å»æ‹…å¿ƒé’±çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼›å®ƒä¼šè‡ªç„¶è€Œç„¶åœ°å¾—åˆ°è§£å†³çš„ã€‚åªæ˜¯å°½ä½ æœ€å¤§çš„åŠªåŠ›â€”â€”ç„¶åè¯•ç€è¶…è¶Šå®ƒã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
Youâ€™re poor. You canâ€™t afford to take time off to get another degree so you can get a better job. The answer is to do the best you can, right where you are, and cling onto your dream. Life will give you what you want, when you least expect it: do your best work, every day. Results will come.
ä½ å¾ˆæ‹®æ®ã€‚ä½ æ²¡æ³•æŠ½å‡ºæ—¶é—´è¿›ä¸€æ­¥æ·±é€ æ¥å»æ‰¾ä¸€ä»½æ›´å¥½çš„å·¥ä½œã€‚ç­”æ¡ˆæ˜¯å»å°½ä½ æœ€å¤§çš„åŠªåŠ›ï¼Œåœ¨å½“ä¸‹ï¼ŒåšæŒè‡ªå·±çš„æ¢¦æƒ³ã€‚ç”Ÿæ´»ä¼šåœ¨ä½ æ„æƒ³ä¸åˆ°çš„æ—¶å€™ç»™äºˆä½ æƒ³è¦çš„ï¼šæ¯å¤©éƒ½å°½ä½ æœ€å¤§çš„åŠªåŠ›ï¼Œæœ‰ä»˜å‡ºå°±æœ‰ç»“æœã€‚

8. Donâ€™t Quit

ä¸è¦æ”¾å¼ƒ

â€œThe difference in winning and losing is most oftenâ€¦ not quitting.â€- Walt Disney
â€œèµ¢å’Œè¾“çš„åŒºåˆ«åœ¨äºï¼Œå¤§éƒ¨åˆ†çš„æ—¶å€™â€¦.ä¸è¦æ”¾å¼ƒã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
You canâ€™t succeed at anything without failing, and failing a lot. Failure is the way we learn. Hereâ€™s what Thomas Edison said: â€œThe three great essentials to achieve anything worthwhile are, first, hard work; second, stick-to-itiveness; third, common sense.â€ Everyone fails his way to success. Look on your failures as speed bumps in your success journey, and keep going. Donâ€™t quit.
å¦‚æœä¸ç»å†å¤±è´¥ï¼Œä¸ç»å†å¾ˆå¤šæ¬¡çš„å¤±è´¥ï¼Œä½ æ˜¯æ— æ³•æˆåŠŸçš„ã€‚å¤±è´¥æ˜¯æˆ‘ä»¬å­¦ä¹ çš„æ–¹å¼ã€‚çˆ±è¿ªç”Ÿæ›¾è¯´è¿‡ï¼šâ€œè¦æƒ³å®Œæˆä»»ä½•æœ‰æ„ä¹‰çš„äº‹æƒ…ï¼Œéƒ½éœ€è¦ä¸‰ä¸ªå¿…è¦æ¡ä»¶ï¼šç¬¬ä¸€æ˜¯è‰°è‹¦çš„åŠªåŠ›ï¼›ç¬¬äºŒæ˜¯åšæŒï¼›ç¬¬ä¸‰æ˜¯å¸¸è¯†ã€‚â€ æ¯ä¸ªäººéƒ½æ˜¯é€šè¿‡å¤±è´¥èµ°å‘æˆåŠŸçš„ã€‚æŠŠä½ çš„å¤±è´¥çœ‹æˆæ˜¯é€šå¾€æˆåŠŸè·¯ä¸Šçš„å‡é€Ÿå¸¦ï¼Œç»§ç»­å‰è¿›ï¼Œä¸è¦æ”¾å¼ƒã€‚

9. Be Grateful

å¿ƒæ€€æ„Ÿæ¿€

â€œThe more you are in a state of gratitude, the more you will attract things to be grateful for.â€- Walt Disney
â€œä½ è¶Šç»å¸¸å¿ƒæ€€æ„Ÿæ¿€ä¹‹æƒ…ï¼Œå°±è¶Šä¼šæœ‰æ›´å¤šå€¼å¾—ä½ æ„Ÿæ©çš„äº‹æƒ…å‘ç”Ÿåœ¨ä½ èº«ä¸Šã€‚â€â€”â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
What are you grateful for? We all have endless reasons to be grateful. What do you take for granted? Chances are that youâ€™re blasÃ© about your health, your comfortable home, your loving family, and about your job. Even if you have none of those things, you can be grateful for being alive. Studies have shown that gratitude improves your health, your relationships, and makes you happier.
ä½ å› ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆäº‹æƒ…æ„Ÿæ©ï¼Ÿæˆ‘ä»¬éƒ½å› ä¸ºå„ç§åŸå› è€Œå¿ƒæ€€æ„Ÿæ¿€ä¹‹æƒ…ã€‚ä½ æŠŠä»€ä¹ˆä¸œè¥¿è§†ä¸ºç†æ‰€å½“ç„¶ï¼Ÿå¾ˆæœ‰å¯èƒ½ä½ å¯¹è‡ªå·±çš„å¥åº·çŠ¶å†µã€èˆ’é€‚çš„å®¶ã€å……æ»¡çˆ±çš„å®¶åº­å’Œä½ çš„å·¥ä½œå·²æ— åŠ¨äºè¡·äº†ã€‚å³ä½¿æ˜¯è¿™äº›ä½ éƒ½æ²¡æœ‰ï¼Œä½ ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥å› ä¸ºæ´»ç€è€Œæ„Ÿæ©ã€‚ç ”ç©¶è¡¨æ˜ï¼Œæ„Ÿæ©èƒ½æ”¹å–„ä½ çš„å¥åº·çŠ¶å†µã€ä½ çš„æ‹çˆ±å…³ç³»ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è®©ä½ æ›´åŠ å¹¸ç¦ã€‚

10. Do Your Best

å…¨åŠ›ä»¥èµ´

â€œWhy worry? If youâ€™ve done the very best you can, worrying wonâ€™t make it better.â€- Walt Disneyâ€œ
ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¦æ‹…å¿ƒï¼Ÿå¦‚æœä½ å°½åŠ›äº†ï¼Œæ‹…å¿ƒä¸ä¼šè®©äº‹æƒ…å˜å¾—æ›´å¥½ã€‚â€œ-â€”åç‰¹Â·è¿ªå£«å°¼
Worry is anticipation; worry can help you to improve and do your best. However, once something is done, distract yourself from concern about the results. If youâ€™ve gone through three interviews for a job, thereâ€™s nothing else you can do. Worrying about whether you get the job is pointless at that stage. Only worry when it serves a useful purpose.
æ‹…å¿ƒå°±æ˜¯æœŸæœ›ï¼›æ‹…å¿ƒèƒ½å¸®ä½ æé«˜æ°´å¹³å¹¶è®©ä½ å°½åŠ›è€Œä¸ºã€‚ç„¶è€Œä¸€æ—¦åšäº†æŸä»¶äº‹åï¼Œä¸è¦è®©è‡ªå·±åˆ†å¿ƒå»æ‹…å¿ƒç»“æœã€‚å¦‚æœä½ æ‰¾ä¸€ä»½å·¥ä½œæ—¶é€šè¿‡ä¸‰æ¬¡é¢è¯•ï¼Œé‚£èƒ½åšçš„ä½ éƒ½åšäº†ã€‚è¿™æ—¶æ‹…å¿ƒè‡ªå·±æ˜¯å¦èƒ½å¾—åˆ°è¿™ä»½å·¥ä½œæ˜¯æ¯«æ— æ„ä¹‰çš„ã€‚åªæœ‰åœ¨æ‹…å¿ƒæœ‰ç›Šçš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹æ‰æ‹…å¿ƒã€‚

So, there you have ten Walt Disney lessons. Apply them to your life. Theyâ€™ll help you to make your dreams come true.

entry.title: Contiki-CC2538-CoAP
entry.content:
Mote1

build rp-border-router

cd ~
cd contiki/examples/ipv6/rpl-border-router

make TARGET=cc2538dk all

program cc2538,(select + reset on CC2538DK)

../../../tools/cc2538-bsl/cc2538-bsl.py -v -e -w border-router.bin

push reset button, see console print

../../../tools/sky/serialdump-linux -b115200 /dev/ttyUSB0

Mote2

build er-rest-example

cd ~
cd contiki/examples/er-rest-example

make TARGET=cc2538dk all

program cc2538,(select + reset on CC2538DK)

../../../tools/cc2538-bsl/cc2538-bsl.py -p /dev/ttyUSB1 -v -e -w er-example-server.bin

push reset button, see console print

../../../tools/sky/serialdump-linux -b115200 /dev/ttyUSB1

run tunslip6

cd ~
cd contiki/examples/ipv6/rpl-border-router
sudo ../../../tools/tunslip6 aaaa::1/64 -s /dev/ttyUSB0

ping6

ping6 aaaa::212:4b00:5af:84e0

firefox

entry.title: linkit-smart-7688-build
entry.content:
linkit-smart-feed

This feeds holds the SDK wifi driver and the config/meta package for the LinkIt Smart 7688 (Duo)

Build the firmware from sources

This section describes how to build the firmware for LinkIt Smart 7688 and LinkIt Smart 7688 Duo from source codes.

Host environment

The following operations are performed under a Ubuntu LTS 14.04.3 environment. For a Windows or a Mac OS X host computer, you can install a VM for having the same environment:

  • Download Ubuntu 14.04.3 LTS image from http://www.ubuntu.com
  • Install this image with VirtualBox (http://virtualbox.org) on the host machine. 50GB disk space reserved for the VM is recommanded

Steps

In the Ubuntu system, open the Terminal application and type the following commands:

  1. Install prerequisite packages for building the firmware:

  2. Download OpenWrt CC source codes:

  3. Prepare the default configuration file for feeds:

  4. Add the LinkIt Smart 7688 feed:

  5. Update the feed information of all available packages for building the firmware:

  6. Install all packages:

  7. Prepare the kernel configuration to inform OpenWrt that we want to build an firmware for LinkIt Smart 7688:

    Select the options as below: 

    - Target System: `Ralink RT288x/RT3xxx`
- Subtarget: `MT7688 based boards`
- Target Profile: `LinkIt7688`

    Save and exit (use the deafult config file name without changing it)

  1. Start the compilation process:

  2. After the build process completes, the resulted firmware file will be under bin/ramips/openwrt-ramips-mt7688-LinkIt7688-squashfs-sysupgrade.bin. Depending on the H/W resources of the host environment, the build process may take more than 2 hours.

>

entry.content:
1. download Kali Linux iso images from http://www.kali.org/downloads/
  2. Format the usb stick in disk utility as msdos
  3. Open Terminal Window and run the following
  1. my USB device is /dev/disk2, Then unmount disk by diskutil command
  1. You may have to run this as sudo

CoAP




CoAPæ˜¯å—é™åˆ¶çš„åº”ç”¨åè®®(Constrained Application Protocol)çš„ä»£åè¯ã€‚åœ¨æœ€è¿‘å‡ å¹´çš„æ—¶é—´ä¸­ï¼Œä¸“å®¶ä»¬é¢„æµ‹ä¼šæœ‰æ›´å¤šçš„è®¾å¤‡ç›¸äº’è¿æ¥ï¼Œè€Œè¿™äº›è®¾å¤‡çš„æ•°é‡å°†è¿œè¶…äººç±»çš„æ•°é‡ã€‚åœ¨è¿™ç§å¤§èƒŒæ™¯ä¸‹ï¼Œç‰©è”ç½‘å’ŒM2MæŠ€æœ¯åº”è¿è€Œç”Ÿã€‚è™½ç„¶å¯¹äººè€Œè¨€ï¼Œè¿æ¥å…¥äº’è”ç½‘æ˜¾å¾—æ–¹ä¾¿å®¹æ˜“ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å¯¹äºé‚£äº›å¾®å‹è®¾å¤‡è€Œè¨€æ¥å…¥äº’è”ç½‘éå¸¸å›°éš¾ã€‚åœ¨å½“å‰ç”±PCæœºç»„æˆçš„ä¸–ç•Œï¼Œä¿¡æ¯äº¤æ¢æ˜¯é€šè¿‡TCPå’Œåº”ç”¨å±‚åè®®HTTPå®ç°çš„ã€‚ä½†æ˜¯å¯¹äºå°å‹è®¾å¤‡è€Œè¨€ï¼Œå®ç°TCPå’ŒHTTPåè®®æ˜¾ç„¶æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªè¿‡åˆ†çš„è¦æ±‚ã€‚ä¸ºäº†è®©å°è®¾å¤‡å¯ä»¥æ¥å…¥äº’è”ç½‘ï¼ŒCoAPåè®®è¢«è®¾è®¡å‡ºæ¥ã€‚CoAPæ˜¯ä¸€ç§åº”ç”¨å±‚åè®®ï¼Œå®ƒè¿è¡ŒäºUDPåè®®ä¹‹ä¸Šè€Œä¸æ˜¯åƒHTTPé‚£æ ·è¿è¡ŒäºTCPä¹‹ä¸Šã€‚CoAPåè®®éå¸¸çš„å°å·§ï¼Œæœ€å°çš„æ•°æ®åŒ…ä»…ä¸º4å­—èŠ‚ã€‚

mbed OS




ç›¸å…³æ”¯æŒ: BLE,Celluar,WIFI,Zigbee,6LoWPAN

ä¸€æ¬¾åŸºäºARM Cortex-Må¤„ç†å™¨çš„è®¾å¤‡æ‰€è®¾è®¡çš„å…è´¹æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿï¼Œé…æœ‰å®‰å…¨ã€é€šè®¯å’Œè®¾å¤‡ç®¡ç†æ¨¡å—ï¼Œæ”¯æŒä½åŠŸç‡æ™ºèƒ½è“ç‰™æ ‡å‡†ã€2Gã€3Gä¸CDMAé€šä¿¡æŠ€æœ¯ã€Threadã€Wi-Fiã€802.15.4/6LoWPANã€TLS/DTLSã€CoAPã€HTTPã€MQTTä»¥åŠè½»é‡çº§çš„M2Mã€‚è€Œåªéœ€32-64kbRAMå’Œ256 kbé—ªå­˜çš„é…ç½®ï¼Œé€‚åˆåœ¨å°è®¾å¤‡ä¸Šè¿è¡Œã€‚

mbedâ„¢ OS is an operating system for IoT devices and is especially well-suited to run in energy constrained environments. The OS includes the connectivity, security and device management functionalities required in every IoT device.

  • Connectivity protocol stack support for BluetoothÂ® low energy, Cellular, Ethernet, Thread, Wi-fiÂ®, Zigbee IP, Zigbee NAN, 6LoWPAN
  • Automation of power management
  • Software asset protection and secure firmware updates for device security & management
  • Supports a wide range of ARM Cortex-M based hardware platforms from major MCU vendors
  • Support for OMA Lightweight M2M protocol for device management
  • Updatable and secure devices at the edge capable of additional processing and functionality
  • Banking-class end-to-end IP security across the communication channels through TLS & DTLS
  • Future proof designs by supporting all the key open standards for connectivity and device management

Salvo

Salvoâ„¢ is the first Real-Time Operating System (RTOS) designed expressly for very-low-cost embedded systems with severely limited program and data memory. libcoap

è¯­è¨€: C

ä¸»é¡µ: http://sourceforge.net/projects/libcoap/

Lightweight application-protocol for devices that are constrained their resources such as computing power, RF range, memory, bandwith, or network packet sizes. This protocol, CoAP, is developed in the IETF working group â€œCoREâ€, http://6lowapp.net.

coap

ä¸»é¡µ: https://github.com/openwsn-berkeley/coap

A CoAP Python library

This package implements the Constrained Application Protocol (CoAP) developed by the IETF CORE working group.

Californium (Cf) CoAP

è¯­è¨€: Java

ä¸»é¡µ: https://github.com/mkovatsc/Californium

Californium (Cf) is an open source implementation of the Constrained Application Protocol (CoAP). It is written in Java and targets unconstrained environments such as back-end service infrastructures (e.g., proxies, resource directories, or management services) and less constrained environments such as embedded devices running Linux (e.g., smart home controllers or vehicle sensors). Californium (Cf) has been running code for the IETF standardization of CoAP and was recently reimplemented to straighten changed design decisions, but also to improve its performance with focus on scalability. The new implementation was successfully tested at the ETSI CoAP#3 and OMA LWM2M Plugtests in November 2013.

#Apparently Yun uses avrdude linuxgpio, this is suggested by /etc/linino/test_avrdude.sh

#run-avrdude wants to edit sys/class/gpio/gpio21/value which does not exist here

#Also see http://www.tonylianlong.com/?p=135

#It has modified files for the Arduino IDE and it has the GPG key and gpg binary

#They have also a modified /usr/bin/run-avrdude script which is pure genius, it changes linuxgpio to serial programming and if that is all that is required to change makes it trivial to hook up different boards via USB as well:

#!/bin/sh

#echo 1 > /sys/class/gpio/gpio21/value

#avrdude -c linuxgpio -C /etc/avrdude.conf -p m32u4 -U lfuse:w:0xFF:m -U hfuse:w:0xD8:m -U efuse:w:0xFB:m -Uflash:w:$1:i $2

#echo 0 > /sys/class/gpio/gpio21/value

2015-07-24 YunWebUI

å°†feeds.confä¸­

æ›¿æ¢ä¸º

Development: the easy way
The easiest way to hack the web panel is to copy on your YÃºn the files you find in this repo, maintaining the folders structure.
For example, file usr/lib/lua/luci/controller/arduino/index.lua will go to /usr/lib/lua/luci/controller/arduino/index.lua on your YÃºn.
Then access the webpanel at http://arduino.local/ (where â€œarduinoâ€ is the name of your YÃºn), properly edit file index.lua and refresh the page to see the changes.
Once done, copy the files back to your pc and submit us a pull request, so that everyone can take advantage of the improvements you made.
Development: the fast, local but hard way
You need a GNU/Linux box and the following tools: subversion, gnupg, lua, make, gcc, wget. On Debian based distros, these are packages subversion, gnupg, lua5.1, liblua5.1-0-dev, build-essential, wget.

æzigbeeç®—æ˜¯å›½å†…ç¬¬ä¸€æ‰¹äº†ï¼Œå¾ˆæ—©å°±çŸ¥é“6lowpanã€‚ç”¨cc2430æ—¶ï¼Œä»ç ”ç©¶http://www.tinyos8051wg.netï¼Œæ‰¾å¯»èµ„æ–™äº†è§£åˆ° Nanostack1.0.0ï¼Œç›´åˆ°Nanostack1.1.0 ä¹‹åå°±è½¬ä¸ºcontikiäº†ã€‚å¥½ä¹…æ²¡å‘å¸–äº†ï¼Œå‘ä¸ªå¸–Markä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œå…ˆï¼

1.Download Instant Contiki

2.Install VMWare Player

https://my.vmware.com/web/vmware/free#desktop_end_user_computing/vmware_player/5_0

4.ç¼–è¯‘~/contiki/examples/cc2530dkä¸‹ä¾‹å­ï¼Œéœ€è¦å…ˆå®‰è£…SDCC.

  cd /opt/sdcc

  â€¢Run this:

  sudo ./configure â€“disable-gbz80-port â€“disable-z80-port â€“disable-ds390-port \

  â€“disable-ds400-port â€“disable-pic14-port â€“disable-pic16-port \

  â€“disable-hc08-port â€“disable-r2k-port â€“disable-z180-port \

  4.3ï¼‰ç¼–è¯‘ï¼Œå®‰è£…

  4.4ï¼‰å®Œæˆ

  sdcc -v

  SDCC : mcs51 3.1.1 #7100 (Jan 10 2013) (Linux)

5.ç¼–è¯‘cc2530dk

  5.1) hello world

  cd ~/contiki/examples/cc2530dk

  make hello-world

  ç¼–è¯‘å®Œæˆ

  user@instant-contiki:~/contiki/examples/cc2530dk$ ls

  blink-hello.c         hello-world.c         obj_cc2530dk           timer-test.c

  5.2) udp-ipv6

  æŠ¥é”™ï¼Œç¼ºå°‘srecord

  Pack hex file

6.TI SmartRF Flash Programmer çƒ§å½• *.hex

  ##########################################

  Hello World!

7.å»ºç«‹è‡ªå·±çš„ç¡¬ä»¶å¹³å°[æˆ‘çš„æ˜¯ï¼šedutech]å’Œå·¥ç¨‹[æˆ‘çš„æ˜¯ï¼šedutech]

  7.1) cpu

file_pat = re.compile(â€˜obj_edutech[^ ]+.â€˜)

  bank-alloc.py æ›¿æ¢ä¸º bank-alloc-edutech.py

  7.2) platform

  vi Makefile.edutech

  ç¼–è¾‘ç¬¬1è¡Œ[éå¿…é¡»]

  ä¿å­˜

  :wq

  æ¥ä¸‹æ¥æ ¹æ®å®é™…ç¡¬ä»¶æƒ…å†µï¼Œç¼–è¾‘æˆ–åˆ›å»ºé©±åŠ¨æ–‡ä»¶

  7.3) project

  :wq   make

  çƒ§å½•

using TI CC Debugger (based on Ubuntu)

install Package libboost-all-dev and libusb-1.0-0-dev by using command

sudo apt-get install libboost-all-dev

sudo apt-get install libusb-1.0-0-dev

  • download cc-tool source code from https://github.com/misham/cc-tool
  • extract cc-tool source code and install by using command
sudo wget https://github.com/misham/cc-tool/archive/master.zip

sudo unzip master.zip

cd cc-tool- master

sudo ./configure

make

make install
  • use lsusb command for list your Board
lsusb
  • the output should be

..Bus 006 Device 015: ID 0451:16a0 Texas Instruments, Inc. Bus 006 Device 013: ID 0451:16a0 Texas Instruments, Inc. ..

  • change directory to your .hex file
(example /home/user/contiki-sensinode/examples/cc2530dk)

cd /home/user/contiki-sensinode/examples/cc2530dk

Programmer: SmartRF05EB Target: CC2530 Erasing flashâ€¦ Erasing completed Writing flashâ€¦ (42 KB)â€¦ Writing completed (3.13 s.) Verifying flashâ€¦ Verification completed (3.33 s.)
